file_content.text: Percentage of city infrastructure still standing = surprising
So this is what a dead city looks like. Feels like we're standing on an open grave.
Taris. Good hunt grounds. Worthy challenges for us.
Ugh! You smell that, Captain? Taris is like a dead gundark wearing dirty old socks. Doesn't look much better, either.
This place used to rival Coruscant? Blasted Sith must have laid down some serious ordnance.
T7 = setting sensors to maximum range
This planet gives me the creeps. I keep expecting something awful to come shambling out of the swamp.
Better to seek enemies, than wait for.
Those security boys look nervous. Bet they drew the short straw to land this duty.
I've seen the look on those guards' eyes a thousand times--they're expecting trouble.
Cantina = popular with reclamation effort personnel
Huh. No windows. Guess nobody wants to be reminded of where they're drinking.
Why is drinking here, when so much to hunt outside?
Now this is a nice cantina. Nothing fancy, just a place to relax. Might be my favorite part of Taris.
Reconstruction is just started, but they've already got a cantina. Good to see the priorities are straight.
Sensors = detecting rakghoul organics
Oh, look. A dark, shadowy ravine. Nothing bad ever happens in those.
This place I know. Bad footing, but hunted well.
This prize we're after better be worth rooting through the swamp fighting rakghouls.
Dead trees, muck and narrow terrain--we'd better watch for ambushes.
Starship wreckage = Endar Spire // Famous vessel!
I think that's the Endar Spire. The Sith shot it down before they leveled Taris.
Old, old ship. Dreaming old dreams, I think.
Bet that was a fine starship when it was flying. I can just make out the name... "Endar Spire."
The Endar Spire. She was ambushed by the Sith, just before Taris was destroyed. Old girl went down fighting.
Republic rebuilding effort = making progress
Still can't believe we're trying to rebuild this planet. It's gonna take centuries.
Why rebuild? Is better Taris return to wilderness.
The Republic must have big plans for this area. That kind of crane could hoist up a skyscraper.
Wonder if they'll ever get this place back to how it was.
Republic reconstruction = sabotaged // Jedi + T7 = put things right
Getting hard to tell the new construction from the ruins around here.
Even if completed, Taris will reshape.
Which part is the new building? It all looks busted to me.
Good to see something new being built in the middle of all these ruins.
T7 = on full alert // T7 = warn Jedi of hostile ambush
There has got to be a less creepy way to get around. Have I mentioned I have a problem with enclosed spaces?
Hmph. Have become prey in maze.
How come we always wind up walking through sewer pipes? Just once, I'd like to come back from a place smelling like flowers.
Looks like this used to be a sewage pipe. The destruction must've gone really deep.
Lake + high acid content // Swimming = not encouraged
That water smells even worse than it looks. Must be where the scavengers take their baths.
Care, Herald. Is no water. Stinks of acid.
Is that lake made of acid, or what? Can we please stop discovering new smells? My nose can't take any more.
There's no telling what's in that water. Probably every toxic chemical from every collapsed building for a click in every direction.
Taris city support columns = still standing // Construction = solid
Sometimes, if you squint, Taris is almost beautiful. Almost.
When all was city, these carried weight of buildings. People. Entire world.
Those old support struts almost look like metal trees. It's kinda nice. You could practically have a picnic here.
I can't believe those supports are still standing after all this time.
T7 = detecting humanoid organics // Analysis = hostile scavengers
Who would live in a place this foul? Oh, right--criminals and scavengers.
Is places for hungry and hopeful to hide.
These scavengers have the right idea. Stay underground, where the rakghouls and smells can't get you.
Hmm. Basement levels, or just a whole building that sunk down? Hard to tell.
Gas = non-toxic
You take me to the nicest places. Don't mind me, I'll just be holding my breath.
Air smells bad.
More swamp gas? Oh, that's great. I don't think I can hold my breath the whole time we're on Taris....
Some kind of old chemical factory. Let's watch our step, huh?
T7 = detecting pirate transmission signals
A base made of junk. Have to hand it to the pirates. They have perfect camouflage.
Desperate ones here.
Scrap metal recon towers and weapons everywhere. Looks like we might've found Taris's famous pirates.
Someone's made a camp down here. Better watch for hostiles.
Outpost = safe from rakghouls
This looks like an old swoop race track. Bet this used to be a happening place.
Is said this is old track. No tracks to my seeing.
I recognize the layout of this place. It's an old swoop racing track. Wish I had a Skybird Mark Three to ride around this in....
Looks like an old swoop track. I've heard racing was a major sport here, back before the Sith attack.
Jedi = stay close // T7 = detecting rakghouls
All right. Officially reaching maximum creep-out factor. Don't know what these bones belonged to, but I hope we don't meet a live one.
Beast must have had magnificent death.
I don't even wanna know what left these bones behind. Whatever it was, can't be good.
What could've left bones this big in a place like this?
T7 = recommend extreme caution here
There's something strange about this place. A presence. Can't tell if it's good or bad.
Scents here are... strange.
You sure coming here was a good idea, Captain? These aren't your ordinary rakghouls.
This place looks like a bunker. I wonder if anything inside survived the Sith attack?
Technology = Imperial + advanced // Enemy = strong
An entire Imperial base, right under our noses. Isn't that just like the Empire?
Feel of madness here.
Davik Kang built this vault to last. Everything here's in perfect condition.
We're coming for you, Needles. Time to pay for what you've done.
